info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 11:52PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Berkshire County through 1215 AM EDT... At 1151 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near East Windsor, or 10 miles east of Pittsfield, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Savoy, Berkshire, Windsor, Peru and Brier. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
